intro: Euporteria villosa, commonly known as the woolly euporteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to the southeastern United States, it thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along streambanks. The plant's unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an important component of its native ecosystem. Its flowers attract various pollinators, contributing to local biodiversity.
